objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: UK National Cyber Security Centre; the author and publisher of this threat report. Provides analysis of the Hexed Noodle/AppleSeed Android backdoor and its operational details.

objects.name: C2 domain
objects.description: Command and control domain used by Hexed Noodle for tasking and exfiltration traffic.

objects.name: C2 domain
objects.description: Alternative command and control domain used by Hexed Noodle.

objects.name: Beacon request
objects.description: Malware beacon HTTP POST URL used for periodic device information transmission to C2.

objects.name: Exfiltration request
objects.description: Malicious HTTP POST URL used for exfiltration of files/SMS messages to C2 server.

objects.name: Tasking request
objects.description: Malware uses this URL format for requesting new operator tasks from C2 server.

objects.name: Tasking acknowledgement
objects.description: URL used to acknowledge receipt of commands from the C2 server.

objects.name: User storage partition
objects.description: Android user storage partition targeted for file monitoring and exfiltration by malware.

objects.name: Indicator for KisaAndroidSecurity.apk (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of malicious Hexed Noodle APK masquerading as a Korean security app.

objects.name: Indicator for KisaAndroidSecurity.apk (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of malicious Hexed Noodle APK masquerading as a Korean security app.

objects.name: Indicator for KisaAndroidSecurity.apk (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of malicious Hexed Noodle APK masquerading as a Korean security app.

objects.name: Indicator for Kisa Vaccine.apk (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of malicious APK variant, Kisa Vaccine.apk, masquerading as a Korean security app.

objects.name: Indicator for Kisa Vaccine.apk (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of malicious APK variant, Kisa Vaccine.apk, masquerading as a Korean security app.

objects.name: Indicator for Kisa Vaccine.apk (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of malicious APK variant, Kisa Vaccine.apk, masquerading as a Korean security app.

objects.name: hexed noodle
objects.description: Hexed Noodle is an Android variant of the AppleSeed backdoor, masquerading as a (South) Korean Internet Security Agency (KISA) mobile security app. It performs execution of shell commands, both tasked and automated collection of filesystem contents and SMS messages, and periodic beaconing via HTTP POST. It targets security-conscious South Korean users by pretending to be a legitimate security app. The malware creates tasks for command beacons, SMS monitoring, and file monitoring, collects and exfiltrates specific file types and SMS messages, and enables remote control, including SMS sending from the device.

objects.name: kisaandroidsecurity.apk
objects.description: An Android backdoor application masquerading as a security app, associated with the Hexed Noodle malware family. Shares behavior and network traffic patterns with known AppleSeed variants targeting South Korea.

objects.name: kisa vaccine.apk
objects.description: A variant of the Android backdoor masquerading as a security app, linked to Hexed Noodle and AppleSeed malware activity. Designed to collect device data and exfiltrate files and SMS messages.

objects.name: appleseed
objects.description: AppleSeed is a backdoor malware with Windows and Android variants, used in targeted campaigns such as Operation Cobra Venom. The Android variant, known as Hexed Noodle, mimics legitimate Korean security apps and exfiltrates files and SMS messages.

objects.name: South Korean Internet Security Agency (KISA)
objects.description: The legitimate Korean governmental organization whose branding and application interface are impersonated by Hexed Noodle to increase trust and evade suspicion among targeted users.

objects.name: Operation Cobra Venom
objects.description: A 2019 operation in which the Windows variant of the AppleSeed backdoor masqueraded as computer security software. The same TTPs are observed in the Hexed Noodle Android variant, implying possible threat actor continuity in targeting South Korean victims.

objects.name: dexstrings_plaincomms_obfushex_a9ff1e
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule dexstrings_plaincomms_obfushex_a9ff1e {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Plaintext strings from a Hexed Noodle 'classes.dex'
file"
        hash = "a9ff1ebb548f5bba600d38e709ff331749fa9971"

    strings:
        $exfil1 = "multipart/form-data; boundary=$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$"
        $exfil2 = "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"binary\";
filename=\""
        $reqFormatAParam1 = /\?m=[a-d]&p1=/
        $reqFormatAParam2 = /&p2=[a-c]/
        $smsdb = "slist.ldb" //"flist.ldb" (name of the files db) is
obfuscated but the developers have forgotten to wrap this sms database
filename

    condition:
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Masquerade as Legitimate Application
objects.description: Hexed Noodle masquerades as a KISA mobile security app.

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: Hexed Noodle beacons contain device hardware information and phone number.

objects.name: Unix Shell
objects.description: Hexed Noodle system commands are executed by passing them to ‘sh -c’.

objects.name: User Execution
objects.description: The user is required to install the Hexed Noodle APK, accept permissions and launch the app.

objects.name: Broadcast Receivers
objects.description: Hexed Noodle subscribes to BOOT_COMPLETED, MY_PACKAGE_REPLACED, SMS_RECEIVED and PACKAGE_INSTALL broadcasts.

objects.name: Boot Autostart
objects.description: The Hexed Noodle app starts on receipt of the BOOT_COMPLETED notification.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
objects.description: Hexed Noodle configuration is stored in the app as hex encoded strings containing a 16 byte XOR-key prefix – in common with other AppleSeed variants.

objects.name: Archive Collected Data Via Library
objects.description: Hexed Noodle data is Zip compressed before encryption using standard libraries.

objects.name: Capture SMS Messages
objects.description: Hexed Noodle collects SMS messages and certain filesystem documents.

objects.name: Data from Local System
objects.description: Hexed Noodle contains a command to list filesystem contents.

objects.name: Automated Collection
objects.description: Hexed Noodle regularly scans file and SMS directories for changes to trigger exfiltration.

objects.name: Capture SMS Messages
objects.description: Hexed Noodle collects both stored and incoming SMS messages, possibly enabling the bypass of SMS-based two-factor authentication.

objects.name: File and Directory Discovery
objects.description: Hexed Noodle contains a command to list filesystem contents.

objects.name: Web Protocols
objects.description: Hexed Noodle uses HTTP requests for tasking and exfiltration.

objects.name: Data Transfer Size Limits
objects.description: Hexed Noodle uploads files in chunks of at most 10MB.

objects.name: Exfiltration over C2 Channel
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltration and tasking are HTTP POST requests to the same server with different parameters.

objects.name: Data Encrypted
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltrated data is encrypted, prepended with the 16 byte XOR key and Hex encoded.

objects.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltrates data using HTTP POST requests.

objects.name: SMS Control
objects.description: Hexed Noodle enables the operator to send SMS messages from the victim device.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Hexed Noodle
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. hexed noodle.
